fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Environment, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication
inter_groups: Intergroup on the Welfare and Conservation of Animals
eu_initiatives:
- Review of EC Regulation 543/2008 
- EU Platform on Animal Welfare 
- Use of force-feeding in foie gras production 
- Identification and registration of companion animals 
- Trade agreements 
- Farm animal welfare
relevant_communication:
- Meetings with representatives of EU and national institutions (ongoing) 
- Participation in Experts meetings organised by NGOs (ongoing) 
- Membership of the EU Platform on Animal Welfare on behalf of VIER PFOTEN International (ongoing) 
- Publication of information on the AnimalWelfareAndTrade website (ongoing) 
- Lectures (most recent: Hartpury College - Gloucester, UK, in October 2017) 
- Presentations at international fora 
- Advice to NGOs or private companies on animal welfare-related legislation and standards (ongoing) 
- Production of articles for various media (ongoing) 
- Participation in academic publications (e.g. Inclusión de temas de Bienestar Animal en planes de estudio de Medicina Veterinaria en Latinoamérica - chapter on animal welfare and trade - Ed. Amateditorial (Mexico)- August 2016
customers: humane society international# GAIA# VIER PFOTEN / FOUR PAWS International
goals__remit:
Provision of consultancy and other related services, mainly in - but not limited to – the field of animal welfare. 
Other commercial services provided, if compatible with the company’s ethics.
